body.name: A Miner's Deadly Secret: A Historical Western Adventure Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #14,488 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #30 in Louis L'Amour Westerns #101 in Western Fiction Classics #208 in Westerns (Books)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have never read anything by Austin Grayson before, OMG this was fantastic!! We have greedy people, who only care about the money. We have a good friend, a fiance, and an Indian friend. And of course hired killers. There is an extended ending you can get at the end of the book. Love the plot, great setting, and strong intense interesting characters. I look forward to reading more from Austin Grayson!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Bad guys everywhere
reviews.reviewText: This was a story about a corrupt mine owner, his daughter, and a town that had been crushed under the will of a bad man. The son-in-law Buck, and his friend Henry had lost touch a bit but found that Buck remembered where there was gold buried and sent his friend to get it. During that time the town was being harassed by gunslingers that the mine owner brought to town. The town fights back and things turn around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An intriguing story
reviews.reviewText: This was an interesting story that has lots of twists as you read to get all the answers! I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy from this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars A Miner's Deadly Secret
reviews.reviewText: I was very disappointed in this book. The story jumped from person to person, and place to place, confusing at times. The book ended abruptly without a conclusion. I'm surprised Carol Coyer recommended it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kept me from getting sleep
reviews.reviewText: Couldn't put the book down. It was different from many westerns. I did not know we had tin mines. would have liked a better description of them. all in all, it was a good read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Soft Western.
reviews.reviewText: This book has villains, greedy people, killers and religious people thrown together, mixed up and laid out. There are lots of changes from the first of the book till the end. The ending you may have to read twice and don’t forget the extended ending that helps explain a little. Read and enjoy????????

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Search for treasure western
reviews.reviewText: Great story of a crooked Mack tin mine owning an entire city and paying low wages while subjecting the miners to unsafe working conditions. The mine owners daughter, Alexandra, is as evil as her father. Her husband Buck is mistreated by her when ill in order to gain control of a map to gold. Buck sneaks the map to his friend Henry to retrieve the treasure. Henry and his girlfriend Sara go on the adventure to find the gold. Kai an Indian accomp,anies them. After many encounters in the story with gun slingers, hit men, and bombers of TBE tin mine and the arrest of Mack, you are left hanging. Is Alexandra arrested, do they find the gold, if so, what about the thief with them, what happened to Buck. Even the epilogue does not finish the missing pieces. This book would have scored higher if the story had been complete and not as fragmented in each paragraph going back and forth from scene to scene. I read as an ARC and enjoyed the content. I hope to read more of this author but with these improvements.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was a very good read. I totally enjoy the author. Continue the great writing.
